newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Saudi's Ahsa Development plans $4 mln dividend.
newsitem.headline: Saudi's Ahsa Development plans $4 mln dividend.

text.p: Al-Ahsa Development Co of Saudi Arabia said on Sunday it would distribute a 15 million riyal ($4 million) dividend to shareholders for 1996 -- its first dividend since it was set up in late 1993.
General Manager Sadoun Saad al-Sadoun said the company posted a 12.9 million riyal net profit in 1996 and shareholders' equity stood at 348 million riyals at end-1996. He gave no comparative figures.
Sadoun said the company would soon invite bids to build a 50-million-riyal hospital in eastern Saudi Arabia.

The company also plans to build $40 million textile plant. Japan's Marubeni Corporation would provide the technical services and know-how for the plant through a Japanese company specialised in textile production.
